title: 108_hr5182
content: The Homeland Security Civil Rights and Civil Liberties Protection Act of 2004 ensures that civil rights and liberties are not compromised in homeland security efforts. It also establishes an Officer for Civil Rights and Civil Liberties within the Department of Homeland Security. Section 705(a) of the Homeland Security Act of 2002 is amended to ensure reporting directly to the Secretary, addressing concerns on race, ethnicity, and religion profiling, and assisting in developing and reviewing department policies. The Department is required to develop, implement, and review policies to ensure civil rights and civil liberties are protected in its programs. It must oversee compliance with legal requirements and coordinate with other officials to address civil rights, civil liberties, and privacy concerns comprehensively. The Congress must receive reports on programs, policies, and procedures related to civil rights and civil liberties. It is also required to investigate complaints and information indicating possible abuses, unless the Inspector General determines otherwise. SEC. 4. PROTECTION OF CIVIL RIGHTS AND CIVIL LIBERTIES BY OFFICE OF INSPECTOR GENERAL. Designation and Functions of Senior Official under Homeland Security Act of 2002 amended to include oversight of civil rights and civil liberties. The Inspector General of the Department of Homeland Security designates a senior official to coordinate investigations of abuses of civil rights and civil liberties within the department and its contractors or grantees. The Inspector General of the Department of Homeland Security designates a senior official to coordinate investigations of alleged abuses of civil rights and civil liberties by employees or officials of the Department or its contractors/grantees. This includes initiating investigations, ensuring personnel receive proper training, and consulting with the Officer for Civil Rights and Civil Liberties for policy recommendations. The Office of Inspector General coordinates investigations of civil rights and civil liberties abuses, provides information to the Officer for Civil Rights and Civil Liberties, publicizes complaint procedures, and informs the Officer of investigation statuses. The Office of Inspector General must report any weaknesses, problems, or deficiencies related to civil rights or civil liberties to the Officer for Civil Rights and Civil Liberties. The Office of Inspector General must report any weaknesses, problems, or deficiencies related to civil rights or civil liberties to the Privacy Officer. The Homeland Security Act of 2002 is amended to include a Privacy Officer who reports directly to the Secretary. The Privacy Officer is responsible for coordinating with the Officer for Civil Rights and Civil Liberties to ensure that programs, policies, and procedures involving civil rights, civil liberties, and privacy are addressed comprehensively and that appropriate reports are provided to Congress.
